name: Strontium oxide
desc: Strontium oxide or strontia, SrO, is formed when strontium reacts with oxygen. Burning strontium in air results in a mixture of strontium oxide and strontium nitride. It also forms from the decomposition of strontium carbonate SrCO3. It is a strongly basic oxide.
Solubility:
miscible with potassium hydroxide
slightly soluble in alcohol
insoluble in acetone and ether
Other cations:
Beryllium oxide
Magnesium oxide
Calcium oxide
Barium oxide
